primary.measure: Number of Participants With Viral Load Suppression
primary.description: Viral load suppression was defined as having viral load \< 200 copies/mL by the end of each participant's 12 months of follow-up assessment (with a window from start of 10 months through the end of 16 months post-randomization to accommodate timing of clinical visits).
primary.timeFrame: Targeted time frame is 12 months post-randomization with a possible range of 10-16 months to account for variable timing of clinic visits.

secondary.measure: Number of Participants Retained in Care at 12-month Follow up
secondary.description: Retention in care is a patient defined as having at least one visit in each 6-month period within 12 months post-randomization separated by at least two months.
A 6-month visit gap was defined as having at least 189 days between two sequentially kept visits, post-randomization.
